intro: Gnidia glauca var. sisparensis, commonly known as the Sisparensis gnidia, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
